section.title: Active Allergies and Adverse Reactions - as of 05/14/2014

value.displayName: propensity to adverse reactions to drug

td.paragraph: Patient admitted with hypoxemia and RLL infiltrate. Started on broad spectrum antibiotics
GERD, diagnosed by EGD. Symptoms well controlled with intermittent prn use of H2 blockers.
Started smoking age 16, smoking 1 - 1.5 ppd. Has made several half-hearted attempts to quit but has never been successful for longer than a few days. Only smoker in the family.

observation.text: SCREENING FOR MALIGNANT NEOPLASM OF THE RECTUM

value.displayName: SCREENING FOR MALIGNANT NEOPLASM OF THE RECTUM

td.paragraph: Mild diverticulosis. Otherwise negative screening sigmoidoscopy.
Flexible sigmoidoscopy to 60 cm with Pentax scope without complication.
1+ external and internal hemorrhoids. Scattered sigmoid diverticula. Bowel otherwise negative as far as scoped.

item.caption: SCREENING FOR MALIGNANT NEOPLASM OF THE RECTUM
item.paragraph: Screening for malignant neoplasm of the rectum

item.caption: VACCIN STREP PNEUMONIAE
item.paragraph: Need for prophylatic vaccination against streptococcus pneumoniae
